context_of_use: The admin manages user accounts to control system access.
stakeholders_and_interests: admin: Control system access through user management.
description: Create, update, and control user accounts and access permissions.
preconditions: Admin is logged into the system.
Admin has the necessary permissions to manage user accounts.
postconditions: User accounts are created, updated, or deleted as per admin actions.
assumptions: The admin has the required permissions to manage user accounts.
requirements_met: The system shall allow the admin to create user accounts.
The system shall allow the admin to update user account information.
The system shall allow the admin to delete user accounts.
outstanding_issues: Clarification on the specific permissions required for different user roles.
main_flow: 1. Admin selects the option to manage user accounts → System displays the user management interface.
2. Admin creates a new user account → System saves the new user account and confirms creation.
3. Admin updates an existing user account → System saves the updated user account and confirms the update.
4. Admin deletes a user account → System removes the user account and confirms deletion.
exception_flows: EF-1 (from Step 1): If the admin lacks permissions, the system displays an error message indicating insufficient permissions.
